author: JAMES NEVEAU
title: Rizzo Visits Children's Hospital Tuesday
text:
Privacy Policy | More Newsletters MLB Photos via Getty Images Anthony Rizzo #44 of the Chicago Cubs looks on during batting practice before the National League Wild Card Game against the Pittsburgh Pirates on Wednesday, October 7, 2015 at PNC Park in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Chicago Cubs first baseman Anthony Rizzo has a big game coming up on Tuesday night as he takes the field in Game 3 of the NLCS, but before he arrived at Wrigley, he had another important stop to make. Rizzo went over to Lurie Children’s Hospital on Tuesday afternoon to visit with patients and nurses, and brought lots of smiles to lots of faces in the process. Cubs Set Game 3 Lineup vs. Mets Here’s what Rizzo had to say on Twitter: Thx to all the nurses @LurieChildrens for your amazing care of the patients. Had a great time visiting this morning. pic.twitter.com/Jal5QpEIji — Anthony Rizzo (@ARizzo44) October 20, 2015 The Cubs also posted a couple of pictures of the visit: . @ARizzo44 shared BIG smiles with some special friends before today’s big #NLCS game! #LetsGive pic.twitter.com/Q7NK2b7Dm5 — Chicago Cubs (@Cubs) October 20, 2015 Rizzo is extremely active in the battle against cancer, using the Anthony Rizzo Family Foundation to “raise money for cancer research and to provide support to children and their families battling the disease,” according to the foundation’s website. Rizzo himself is a cancer survivor, having battled Hodgkin’s lymphoma while a member of the Boston Red Sox organization in 2008. Published 43 minutes ago
